info.title: Work Item
info.description: HTTP API for managing work items.

post.description: Creates one workflow with the provided data.

requestBody.description: The parameters for creating the workflow.

put.description: Updates the workflow with the provided ID.

parameters.name: workflowId
parameters.description: The unique ID of the workflow to be updated.

requestBody.description: The parameters for updating the workflow.

get.description: Gets a workflow with the provided ID.

post.description: Deletes one or more workflows identified by their IDs.
Creates one or more work items with the provided data.

requestBody.description: The parameters for creating work items.

200.description: The work items were partially created.

201.description: The work items were created successfully.

post.description:
Queries work items with the provided parameters.


Uses the dynamic LINQ `filter` and `substitutions` properties to filter the work items.These properties are optional.


Uses the `take` and `continuationToken` properties to provide paged responses.


Uses the `orderBy` property to sort the work items.


Uses the `returnCount` to get the `totalCount` of work items matching the filter.


Uses the `projection` to only include the specified fields in the response.

requestBody.description: The parameters for querying work items.

200.description: The work items were queried successfully.
The work items summary was queried successfully.

get.description: Gets a work item with the provided ID.

parameters.name: executionHistory
parameters.description: The mode for selecting execution history.

schema.description: Defines the mode for selecting execution history in a work order request.

parameters.name: workflow
parameters.description: Include the workflow snapshot in the response.

200.description: The work items were queried successfully.

post.description: Deletes one or more work items identified by their IDs.

requestBody.description: The parameters for deleting work items.

200.description: The work items were partially deleted.

204.description: The work items were deleted successfully.

post.description:
Updates one or more work items with the provided data.
    Note: Only basic work item properties can be updated using this API. To update scheduling related properties such as `plannedStartDateTime`, `plannedEndDateTime` and `plannedDurationInSeconds`, utilize the `schedule-workitems` API.

requestBody.description: The parameters for updating work items.

200.description: The work items were partially updated.

post.description:
Schedule work items with the provided information.
    Note: Only scheduling related work item properties can be updated using this API. To update other properties, utilize the `update-workitems` API.

requestBody.description: The parameters for scheduling work items.

200.description: The work items were partially scheduled.

post.description:
Executes the specified action for the work item.
    Note: START and END actions will always be enabled, even if the action is not defined on the work item. If no action is defined for START or END, the default action will be MANUAL.

parameters.name: workItemId
parameters.description: The ID of the work item the action will be performed on.

requestBody.description: The parameters for executing a work item action.

post.description: Creates one or more work item templates with the provided data.

requestBody.description: The parameters for creating work item templates.

200.description: The work item templates were partially created.

201.description: The work item templates were created successfully.

post.description:
Queries work item templates with the provided parameters.


Uses the dynamic LINQ `filter` and `substitutions` properties to filter the work item templates These properties are optional.


Uses the `take` and `continuationToken` properties to provide paged responses.


Uses the `orderBy` property to sort the work item templates.


Uses the `projection` to only include the specified fields in the response.

requestBody.description: The parameters for querying work item templates.

200.description: The work item templates were queried successfully.

post.description: Updates one or more work item templates with the provided data.

requestBody.description: The parameters for updating work item templates.

200.description: The work item templates were partially updated.

post.description: Deletes one or more work item templates identified by their IDs.

requestBody.description: The parameters for deleting work item templates.

200.description: The work item templates were partially deleted.

204.description: The work item templates were deleted successfully.

get.description: Gets all the work item types.

200.description: The work item types are retrieved successfully.

get.description: Returns information about API and available operations.

get.summary: Information about API versions and available operations of version V1 of APIs
get.description: Returns available operations for version V1 of the API.

put in the default workspace if a value is not specified.

Each key will be prefixed with "var-" and the value will be the value of the variable.

functions.description: The list of Salt job functions to execute.

metadata.description: Systems Management Job metadata. `queued` will be ignored.

Job.description: Defines a Systems Management Job to be executed by a work item job execution.

jobs.description:
The list of jobs to execute. When the action is executed, all of the jobs will be queued.
If creating any job fails, all jobs will be canceled. If a job fails during execution,
subsequent jobs will still run.

systemId.description: The ID of the system to execute the jobs on instead of the system associated with the work item.

JobExecutionDefinition.description:
Defines a Systems Management Job execution for a work item. This type will trigger a Jobs and
transition the work item state in accordance with the action.

JobExecutionEvent.description: An event tracking a job execution triggered from a work item.

JobExecutionResult.description: Result of executing a NationalInstruments.WorkItem.Model.Api.V1.ExecutionType.Job work item action.

ManualExecutionDefinition.description:
Defines a manual execution for a work item. This type will not trigger an execution, but will
transition the work item state in accordance with the action.

ManualExecutionEvent.description: An event tracking a manual execution triggered from a work item.

ManualExecutionResult.description: Result of executing a manual work item action.

NoneExecutionDefinition.description: Defines an unimplemented execution for a work item. This type will not trigger an execution or transition the work item state.

notebookId.description: The ID of the notebook to execute.

parameters.description: Dictionary of parameters that will be passed to the notebook when the execution is run.

NotebookExecutionDefinition.description:
Defines a notebook execution for a work item. This type will trigger a notebook execution, and
transition the work item state in accordance with the action.

executionId.description: The ID of the triggered execution

NotebookExecutionEvent.description: An event tracking a notebook execution triggered from a work item.

NotebookExecutionResult.description: Result of executing a notebook work item action.

available.description: Whether the operation is available to the caller

filter.description:
The work item template query filter in [dynamic LINQ](https://github.com/ni/systemlink-OpenAPI-documents/wiki/Dynamic-Linq-Query-Language) format.

            
Operators:
- Equals operator '='. Example: 'x = y' or 'x == y'.
- Not equal operator '!='. Example: 'x != y'.
- Greater than operator '>'. Example: 'x > y'.
- Greater than or equal operator '>='. Example: 'x >= y'.
- Less than operator '<'. Example: 'x < y'.
- Less than or equal operator '<='. Example: 'x <= y'.
- Logical AND operator 'and'. Example: 'x and y' or 'x && y'.
- Logical OR operator 'or'. Example: 'x or y' or 'x || y'.
- Contains operator '.Contains()', used to check whether a string contains another string. Example: 'x.Contains(\"y\")'.
- Does not contain operator '!x.Contains()', used to check whether a string does not contain another string. Example: '!x.Contains(\"y\")'.
            
Allowed properties in the filter are:

- `id`: String representing the ID of a work item template. The value must be a numeric string. Field supports only equals '=' and not equal '!=' operators for filtering.

- `productFamilies`: Array of strings representing the product families to which the work item template belongs.

- `partNumbers`: Array of strings representing the part numbers of the products linked to the work item template.

- `fileIds`: Array of file IDs associated with the work item template.

- `name`: String representing the name of a work item template.

- `type`: String representing the type of work item created from this template.

- `summary`: String representing the summary of a work item template.

- `description`: String representing description of the work item created from this template.

- `templateGroup`: String representing the template group defined by the user.

- `testProgram`: String representing the name of the test program to be executed as part of the work item created from this template.

- `resources.systems.filter`: String representing the filter criteria for selecting the systems that can be used to carry out the work item created from this template.

- `resources.assets.filter`: String representing the filter criteria for selecting the assets that can be used to carry out the work item created from this template.

- `resources.duts.filter`: String representing the filter criteria for selecting the DUTs that can be used to carry out the work item created from this template.

- `resources.fixtures.filter`: String representing the filter criteria for selecting the fixtures that can be used to carry out the work item created from this template.

- `workspace`: String representing the ID of the workspace where the work item template is stored.

- `createdBy`: String representing the user who created the work item template.

- `updatedBy`: String representing the user who most recently updated the work item template.

- `createdAt`: ISO-8601 formatted timestamp indicating when the work item template was created.

- `updatedAt`: ISO-8601 formatted timestamp indicating when the work item template was updated.

- `properties`: Properties associated with the work item created from this template as key-value pairs. Example: properties.Any(key == \"Location\" & value == \"Austin\")
- `workflowId`: String representing the ID of the workflow associated with the work item created from this template.

substitutions.description:
Makes substitutions in the query filter expression using non-negative integers. These integers use the
`@` symbol as a prefix. The filter expression replaces each substitution with the element at the corresponding
index in this list. The index is zero-based. For example, an element at the zeroth index of the substitutions
list replaces `@0` in the filter expression.

take.description: Maximum number of work item templates to return.

orderBy.description: Field by which work item templates can be ordered/sorted.

descending.description: Whether to return the work item templates in the descending order. By default, work item templates are sorted in the ascending order.

continuationToken.description:
A token that allows the user to resume a query at the next item in the matching work item templates. When querying, a token will be returned if a query may be continued.
To obtain the next page of work item templates, pass the token to the service on a subsequent request. The service will respond with a new continuation token. To paginate
work item templates, continue sending requests with the newest continuation token provided by the service until this value is null.

items.description: An enumeration of work item template fields.

projection.description:
Specifies the fields to include with the returned work item templates.
If you do not specify a value, all fields are included.

QueryWorkItemTemplatesRequest.description: Request information for the query work item templates API.

workItemTemplates.description: List of queried work item templates.

continuationToken.description:
A token that allows the user to resume a query at the next item in the matching work item templates. When querying, a token will be returned if a query may be continued.
To obtain the next page of work item templates, pass the token to the service on a subsequent request. The service will respond with a new continuation token. To paginate
workitem templates, continue sending requests with the newest continuation token provided by the service until this value is null.

QueryWorkItemTemplatesResponse.description: Response information for the query work item templates API.

filter.description:
The work item query filter in [Dynamic Linq](https://github.com/ni/systemlink-OpenAPI-documents/wiki/Dynamic-Linq-Query-Language) format.

            
Operators:
- Equals operator '='. Example: 'x = y' or 'x == y'
- Not equal operator '!='. Example: 'x != y'
- Greater than operator '>'. Example: 'x > y'
- Greater than or equal operator '>='. Example: 'x >= y'
- Less than operator '<'. Example: 'x < y'
- Less than or equal operator '<='. Example: 'x <= y'
- Logical AND operator 'and'. Example: 'x and y' or 'x && y'
- Logical OR operator 'or'. Example: 'x or y' or 'x || y'
- Contains operator '.Contains()', used to check whether a string contains another string. Example: 'x.Contains(\"y\")'
- Does not contain operator '!.Contains()', used to check whether a string does not contain another string. Example: '!x.Contains(\"y\")'
            
Allowed properties in the filter are:

- `id`: String representing the ID of a work item. The value must be a numeric string. Field supports only equals '=' and not equal '!=' operators for filtering.

- `name`: String representing the name of a work item.

- `type`: String representing the type of a work item.

- `state`: String enumeration representing the state of the work item. Possible values are: NEW, DEFINED, REVIEWED, SCHEDULED, IN_PROGRESS, PENDING_APPROVAL, CLOSED, CANCELED.

- `substate`: String representing the substate of the work item state.

- `description`: String representing details of a work item.

- `parentId`: String representing the ID of the parent work item.

- `templateId`: String representing the ID of the work item template from which the work item was created.

- `assignedTo`: String representing the user to whom the work item is currently assigned.

- `requestedBy`: String representing the user who requested the work item.

- `testProgram`: String representing the name of the test program to be executed as part of the work item.

- `partNumber`: String representing the part number of the product linked to the work item.

- `timeline.earliestStartDateTime`: ISO-8601 formatted timestamp indicating the earliest date and time when the work item is expected to start.

- `timeline.dueDateTime`: ISO-8601 formatted timestamp indicating the date and time when the work item is expected to close.

- `timeline.estimatedDurationInSeconds`: Integer representing the estimated duration in seconds for the work item to be completed.

- `schedule.plannedStartDateTime`: ISO-8601 formatted timestamp indicating the date and time when the work item is scheduled to start.

- `schedule.plannedEndDateTime`: ISO-8601 formatted timestamp indicating the date and time when the work item is scheduled to end.

- `schedule.plannedDurationInSeconds`: Integer representing the planned duration in seconds specified at the time of scheduling for the work item to be completed.

- `resources.systems.selections.id`: String representing the ID of the system reserved to carry out the work item..

- `resources.systems.selections.targetLocationId`: String representing ID of the location where the system is to be moved.

- `resources.systems.filter`: String representing the filter criteria for selecting the systems that can be used to carry out the work item.

- `resources.assets.selections.id`: String representing the ID of the asset reserved to carry out the work item.

- `resources.assets.selections.targetLocationId`: String representing the ID of the location where the asset is to be moved

- `resources.assets.selections.targetSystemId`: String representing the ID of the system where the asset is to be moved.

- `resources.assets.selections.targetParentId`: String representing the ID of the parent asset to which the asset is to be connected.

- `resources.assets.filter`: String representing the filter criteria for selecting the assets that can be used to carry out the work item.

- `resources.duts.selections.id`: String representing the ID of the DUT reserved to carry out the work item.

- `resources.duts.selections.targetLocationId`: String representing the ID of the location where the DUT is to be moved.

- `resources.duts.selections.targetSystemId`: String representing the ID of the system where the DUT is to be moved.

- `resources.duts.selections.targetParentId`: String representing the ID of the parent asset to which the DUT is to be connected.

- `resources.duts.filter`: String representing the filter criteria for selecting the DUTs reserved to carry out the work item.

- `resources.fixtures.selections.id`: String representing the ID of the fixture reserved to carry out the work item.

- `resources.fixtures.selections.targetLocationId`: String representing the ID of the location where the fixture is to be moved.

- `resources.fixtures.selections.targetSystemId`: String representing the ID of the system where the fixture is to be moved.

- `resources.fixtures.selections.targetParentId`: String representing the ID of the parent asset to which the fixture is to be connected.

- `resources.fixtures.filter`: String representing the filter criteria for selecting the fixtures that can be used to carry out the work item.

- `fileIdsFromTemplate`: Array of file IDs from the template linked to the work item.

- `properties`: Properties associated with the work item as key-value pairs. Example: properties.Any(key == "Location" & value == "Austin")

- `dashboard`: String representing the ID for the dashboard associated with the work item. Example: dashboard.Id == "1234"

- `createdBy`: String representing the user who created the work item.

- `createdAt`: ISO-8601 formatted timestamp indicating when the work item was created.

- `updatedBy`: String representing the user who most recently updated the work item.

- `updatedAt`: ISO-8601 formatted timestamp indicating when the work item was updated.

- `workspace`: String representing the ID of the workspace where the work item is stored.

- `workflowId`: String representing the ID of the workflow associated with the work item.

substitutions.description:
Makes substitutions in the query filter expression using non-negative integers. These integers use the
`@` symbol as a prefix. The filter expression replaces each substitution with the element at the corresponding
index in this list. The index is zero-based. For example, an element at the zeroth index of the substitutions
list replaces `@0` in the filter expression.

take.description: Maximum number of work items to return.

orderBy.description: Field by which work items can be ordered/sorted.

descending.description:
Whether to return the work items in descending order. By default, work items are sorted
in ascending order.

continuationToken.description:
A token that allows the user to resume a query at the next item in the matching work items. When querying, a token will be returned if a query may be continued.
To obtain the next page of work items, pass the token to the service on a subsequent request. The service will respond with a new continuation token. To paginate
work items, continue sending requests with the newest continuation token provided by the service until this value is null.

returnCount.description: Whether to return the total number of work items which match the provided filter, disregarding the take value.

items.description: An enumeration of fields that can be included when querying work items.

projection.description:
Specifies the fields to include with the returned work items.
If you do not specify a value, all fields are included.

QueryWorkItemsRequest.description: Request information for the query work items API.

continuationToken.description:
A token that allows the user to resume a query at the next item in the matching work items. When querying, a token will be returned if a query may be continued.
To obtain the next page of work items, pass the token to the service on a subsequent request. The service will respond with a new continuation token. To paginate
work items, continue sending requests with the newest continuation token provided by the service until this value is null.

totalCount.description: The total number of work items which match the provided filter, disregarding the take value. The `TotalCount` will be added to the response only if the `ReturnCount` is set to `true` in the request.

QueryWorkItemsResponse.description: Response information for the query work items API.

take.description: The maximum number of workflows to return.

continuationToken.description:
A token that allows the user to resume a query at the next workflow. When querying, a token will be returned if a query may be continued.
To obtain the next page of workflows, pass the token to the service on a subsequent request. The service will respond with a new continuation token.
To paginate workflows, continue sending requests with the newest continuation token provided by the service until this value is null.

continuationToken.description:
A token that allows the user to resume a query at the next workflow. When querying, a token will be returned if a query may be continued.
To obtain the next page of workflows, pass the token to the service on a subsequent request. The service will respond with a new continuation token.
To paginate workflows, continue sending requests with the newest continuation token provided by the service until this value is null.

workspace.description:
ID of the workspace where the work item is stored. Setting to `null` will retain the existing workspace.
Updating the workspace requires permission to delete the work item in the current workspace and
create the work item in the new workspace.

mandatory.description: Boolean indicating whether the field is mandatory or optional.

supported.description: Boolean indicating whether the field is supported or not. If not supported, the field will not be returned in the response.

items.description: An event tracking an execution triggered from a work item.

executionHistory.description:
List of executions that have been triggered for the work item sorted in the order they
were triggered. The history is limited to the last 1000 executions. When the limit is exceeded,
the oldest events will be removed.

executionActions.description: Defines the executions that will be used for work item actions.

assignedToUserCount.description: Number of work items `assigned to` the current user which are neither `closed` nor `canceled`.

createdByUserCount.description: Number of work items `created by` the current user which are neither `closed` nor `canceled`.

definedCount.description: Number of work items in the `defined` state.

scheduledCount.description: Number of work items in the `scheduled` state.

inProgressCount.description: Number of work items in the `in progress` state.

pendingApprovalCount.description: Number of work items in the `pending approval` state.

description.description: Description of the work item type.
description.example: Used for scheduling and reserving system or assets that may require periodic maintenance or repair.

fields.description: List of supported fields for the given work item type.

validationRules.description: List of validation rules to be applied in addition to the predefined individual field validation.

fields.description: List of fields on which validation should be done.

message.description: Optional message to return in response if the validation fails.
message.example: Either System IDs, Fixture IDs, or Asset IDs should be provided.

WorkItemTypeValidationRuleConfig.description: List of validation rules to be applied in addition to the predefined individual field validation.

version.description: The version of the web service.

displayText.description: Display text associated with the action.

iconClass.description: The icon to display next to the display text.

i18n.description: Translations of the text used within the action definition.

privilegeSpecificity.description:
The resources for which the user must have the `workitem:ExecuteWithSpecificity` privilege.
The user must also have the `workitem:Execute` privilege.

executionAction.description: The execution definition associated with the action.

WorkflowAction.description: Defines an action for a workflow.

action.description:
The name of the action within the workflow that is available
to be executed.

nextState.description: The state that the work item will enter when the action is executed.

nextSubstate.description: The substate that the work item will enter when the action is executed.

showInUI.description: Whether or not the action should be shown in the UI. If not shown, the action can still be executed programmatically through the API.

WorkflowAvailableAction.description: Defines an action that is available for a state within a workflow.

workspace.description: ID of the workspace where the workflow belongs.

createdBy.description: ID of the user who created the workflow.

updatedBy.description: ID of the user who most recently updated the workflow.

createdAt.description: ISO-8601 formatted timestamp indicating when the workflow was created.

updatedAt.description: ISO-8601 formatted timestamp indicating when the workflow was most recently updated.

WorkflowMetadata.description: Defines the metadata about a workflow.

actions.description: The array of actions defined for the workflow.

states.description: The array of states defined for the workflow.

dashboardAvailable.description: Whether or not the work item dashboard is available for the state.

defaultSubstate.description: The default substate associated with the state.

substates.description: The substates associated with the state.

WorkflowState.description: Defines a state for a workflow.

displayText.description: Display text associated with the substate.

i18n.description: Translations of the text used within the action definition.

availableActions.description: The actions that are available for the substate.

WorkflowSubstate.description:
Defines a substate for a state. Substates indicate the status or an intermediate state
of the work item resulting from actions taken during a top-level state.

localeId.description: The 2-letter locale ID associated with the translation.

WorkflowTranslation.description: Defines localized translations of text used within a workflow
